Package file_handling

Class SessionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • file_handling.SessionManager

  • public class SessionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    An object used to save and load sessions. Sessions are groups of active layers. A session file should end in '.gmcm' and store a layer name on each line.
    Since:
    19/12/17
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Isaac

      Opens a session from a saved file and returns its contents, each line converted to an entry in a String ArrayList, which is then returned.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionManager

        public SessionManager​(TableOfContents tableOfContents)
        Constructor for SessionManager. Builds the currentActiveLayers array.
        Parameters:
        tableOfContents - the table of contents from the main frame.

    • Method Detail

      • saveCurrentSession

        public void saveCurrentSession​(java.lang.String sessionPath)
        Saves the current session to a file. The first 14 lines are application/drawing parameters, the remaining lines are layers.
        Parameters:
        sessionPath - String representing path to file to which to save the session.

      • openSession

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> openSession​(java.lang.String sessionPath)
        Opens a session from a saved file and returns its contents, each line converted to an entry in a String ArrayList, which is then returned.
        Parameters:
        sessionPath - String representing path to file where the session is stored.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of layer name Strings.

      • onSaveSessionIntent

        public void onSaveSessionIntent​()
        Handler function for saving a session. Launches the file chooser and calls the saveSession method. Saves files with a '.gmcm' extension, which contain information about the drawing settings and the layers currently active.

      • onOpenSessionIntent

        public void onOpenSessionIntent​()
        Handler function for opening a session. Launches the file chooser, and parses the selected file, creating a new session from its contents by calling the openSession method.
        • Gets the selected file from the user.
        • Reads the first few lines of the file, which contain things like title, drawing settings, etc. and applies them.
        • Totally removes the current layers and drawing settings.
        • Reads the remaining lines of the tile, which contain the necessary parameters to construct layers from the database.
